articles.title: DPRK to Launch Application Satellite
articles.content:
DPRK to Launch Application Satellite
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is to launch a working satellite, Kwangmyongsong-3, manufactured by itself with indigenous technology to mark the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 A spokesman for the Korean Committee for Space Technology said this in a statement Friday.
					
					 After successfully launching two experimental satellites, DPRK scientists and technicians have steadily conducted scientific researches to develop and utilize working satellites indispensable for the country's economic development in line with the government's policy for space development and peaceful use.
					
					 Through the researches they have made a drastic progress in the field of space science and technology and laid solid material and technological foundations for working satellite launches and operation.
					
					 Kwangmyongsong-3, a polar-orbiting earth observation satellite, will be blasted off southward from the Sohae Satellite Launching Station in Cholsan County, North Phyongan Province between April 12 and 16, lifted by carrier rocket Unha-3. 
					
					 A safe flight orbit has been chosen so that carrier rocket debris to be generated during the flight would not have any impact on neighboring countries. 
					
					 The DPRK will strictly abide by relevant international regulations and usage concerning the launch of scientific and technological satellites for peaceful purposes and ensure maximum transparency, thereby contributing to promoting international trust and cooperation in the field of space scientific researches and satellite launches.
					
					 The upcoming launch will greatly encourage the army and people of the DPRK in the building of a thriving nation and will offer an important occasion of putting the country's technology of space use for peaceful purposes on a higher stage.

articles.title: Korean People Confident of Successful Satellite Launch
articles.content:
Korean People Confident of Successful Satellite Launch
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korean Committee for Space Technology made public a statement at noon Friday that the DPRK will launch an application satellite, Kwangmyongsong-3, manufactured by local scientists and technicians.
					 Upon hearing the news on TV and radio, professors of Kim Chaek University of Technology have been gripped by a great joy, considering it an auspicious event of the nation.
					
					 Prof. and Dr. Jo Jong Thae of the university told KCNA:
					
					 "Our scientists and technicians laid solid scientific and technological foundations for the forthcoming satellite launch, through the successful launch and operation of experimental communications satellite Kwangmyongsong-2 in Juche 98 (2009). No doubt, Kwangmyongsong-3 will be successfully put into orbit at one try."
					
					 Prof. and Dr. Ko Kyong Dal, a candidate academician, said:
					
					 "The news about Kwangmyongsong-3, a complex of science and technology, delights me very much.
					
					 The DPRK owes the rapid progress of space science and technology to the wise guidance of President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il, who laid solid foundations for the nation's science and technology and self-supporting economy.
					
					 The soon-to-be-launched Kwangmyongsong-3 will fully demonstrate the mightiness and dignity of the country."

articles.title: Satellite Launch to Display National Strength of Korea
articles.content:
Satellite Launch to Display National Strength of Korea
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korean Committee for Space Technology announced at noon Friday that the DPRK is to launch Kwangmyongsong-3, a polar-orbiting earth observation satellite, in mid-April.
					 The announcement delights servicepersons and people of the country.
					
					 So Yong Il, an officer of the Korean People's Army, told KCNA:
					
					 "The news makes me feel like moving round the earth aboard the satellite.
					
					 Kwangmyongsong-3 will be a precious legacy of general secretary Kim Jong Il's great efforts devoted to commemorating the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung as an auspicious event to be recorded in the history of the nation."
					
					 Ri Kil Sun, a researcher of the Central Mining Research Institute under the State Academy of Sciences, said:
					
					 "The news about satellite launch reminded me of leader Kim Jong Il's devoted efforts. It is entirely thanks to his wise guidance that our country turned into a nuclear state and a powerful state able to manufacture and launch satellites by itself."
					
					 Choe Man Sun, a work-team head of the Mangyongdae Aeguk Aluminum Sash Factory, said:
					
					 "The launch of satellite will display the potentials of the domestic industry, built up by our people under the leadership of the great leader and the Workers' Party of Korea, and the country's scientific and technological level.
					
					 The Korean people will surely lead a better life in a thriving country. 
					
					 The world will again witness the dignity and invincible power of Songun (military-first) Korea."

articles.title: Announcement on Upcoming Satellite Launch Delights Korean Scientists
articles.content:
Announcement on Upcoming Satellite Launch Delights Korean Scientists
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korean Committee for Space Technology (KCST) announced Friday that the DPRK would launch Kwangmyongsong-3, a polar-orbiting earth observation satellite, by carrier rocket Unha-3 between April 12 and 16 to mark the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 This stirring news has delighted the employees of the State Academy of Sciences.
					
					 A researcher Ri Sun Chol told KCNA:
					
					  "I am very pleased to listen to the news. It makes me feel like embracing the whole of space.
					
					 I keenly realize that our science and technology have developed very much.
					
					 The forthcoming satellite launch will be an epoch-making event and it will once again display the inexhaustible scientific and technological potentials of the DPRK, which has already emerged a political and military power."
					
					  Choe Ung Chol, vice-director of the Central Experiment Analytical Institute, said:
					
					 "This happy news has fuelled my yearning for general secretary Kim Jong Il, who turned our country into a scientific and technological power.
					
					 The whole world will become convinced, through the upcoming satellite launch, of the Korean people's unshakable will to build a thriving country."
					
					  Jo Il Gwang, director of the Institute of Information on Global Environment, said:
					
					 "DPRK scientists and technicians already launched two experimental satellites in line with the government's policy for space development and its peaceful use.
					
					 The DPRK will continue to display its dignity and honor as a country capable of manufacturing and launching satellites."

articles.title: Launch of Working Satellite Will Represent Might of DPRK
articles.content:
Launch of Working Satellite Will Represent Might of DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Korean Committee for Space Technology announced Friday that the DPRK will launch a home-made application satellite to mark the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung (April 15).
					 The announcement has greatly delighted the employees of the State Science and Technology Commission.
					
					 Kang Jong Ryol, an official of the commission, told KCNA:
					
					 "I will be eagerly waiting for the launch of a 'DPRK'-marked working satellite. Now, I feel a great pride in living in a satellite power."
					
					 A section chief, Kim Yong Gon, said:
					
					 "It is really great news. The world will clearly witness the might of the DPRK guided by Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un."
					
					 A department director, O Jong Nam, said:
					
					 "After successfully launching two experimental satellites, DPRK scientists and technicians have steadily conducted scientific researches to develop and utilize working satellites indispensable for the country's economic development. I have no doubt that the upcoming launch will be successful."

articles.title: Launch of Kwangmyongsong-3 Will Be Pride for DPRK
articles.content:
Launch of Kwangmyongsong-3 Will Be Pride for DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Korean Committee for Space Technology in a statement Friday announced that a home-made application satellite would be launched to mark the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung (April 15).
					 The announcement gave a great joy to officials of the Ministry of Railways.
					
					 A department director, Paek Kum Chol, told KCNA:
					
					 "I am so pleased to hear that an earth observation satellite will be launched on the occasion of the Day of the Sun (April 15).
					
					 This news makes me sorely miss general secretary Kim Jong Il, who developed the DPRK into a dignified nuclear state and a satellite manufacturing and launching state."
					
					 Another department director, Kwon Chol, said:
					
					 "The upcoming launch of an application satellite is a great pride for      Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea.
					
					 The launch of the home-made satellite will fully demonstrate once again the might of Songun (military-first) Korea.
					
					 We, railway workers, will greet the President's birth anniversary with increased haulage."

articles.title: KCNA-AP Joint Photo Exhibition Opens in U.S.
articles.content:
KCNA-AP Joint Photo Exhibition Opens in U.S.
 New York, March 15 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition co-sponsored by the Korean Central News Agency and the Associated Press of the U.S. opened with due ceremony at the Rubin Art Museum on March 15 in New York to mark the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 On display at the exhibition under the theme "True Picture of Korea" are photos of undying revolutionary exploits President Kim Il Sung, general secretary Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un performed for the building of a thriving nation, people's happiness, independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and global independence. Photos also deal with their revolutionary activities and great personalities. 
					
					 Among them are photos of the might of a harmonious whole of the leader and people, achievements made by the DPRK in different fields including politics, economy and culture under the leadership of the Party and the leader and happy life of the Korean people. 
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were the KCNA delegation led by First Vice-Director General Kim Chang Gwang and officials of the AP including Senior Vice President Kathleen Carroll and Vice President John Daniszewski, personages of various social standings of the U.S. and those concerned of the museum, New York citizens and members of the DPRK mission at the UN in New York. 
					
					 Donald Rubin, president of the Rubin Foundation, made a congratulatory speech at the ceremony. He welcomed the successful opening of the joint photo exhibition. 
					
					 Expressing hope that the exhibition would be the first step towards cultural and political reconciliation, he prayed for the reconciliation between the two governments of the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 Then Kathleen Carroll said in a speech that April 15 marking the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, founder of the DPRK, is the greatest holiday for the Korean nation. He said he was pleased to open the joint photo exhibition with the approach of the holiday.
					
					 He added that the AP would report worldwide fresh news of what is taking place in the DPRK.
					
					 Kim Chang Gwang warmly hailed the opening of the joint photo exhibition in New York on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung, the significant Day of the Sun. 
					
					 He hoped that the exhibition would provide a visual introduction of important events in the DPRK, news of building a thriving nation as well as culture and history of Korea and thus make contributions to promoting mutual understanding between the peoples of the DPRK and the U.S. and improving the bilateral relations.
					
					 The participants looked round the photos on display. They compared the different styles of photography of the KCNA and the AP and had new visual understanding of the DPRK. 
					
					 In the evening a reception was given on the opening of the exhibition. 
					
					 The joint photo exhibition which opened under a MoU signed between the two news agencies in June last year will remain open till April 13.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Learns about Work at Musan Mining Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Learns about Work at Musan Mining Complex
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim learned about the work at the Musan Mining Complex on the spot Thursday.
					 The workers of the complex in charge of the lifeline of metal industry are alive with a high-pitched drive for increased production to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and greet the Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea with high political enthusiasm and great labor achievements. 
					
					 They expanded ore-dressing systems for the production of concentrated ore at Ore-dressing Workshop No. 2 and put the existing ones on a modern basis on a high level, thus providing a bright prospect for completing the construction of large cone-style crushing ground No. 2 before the Day of the Sun, April 15.
					
					 Technological updating made a rapid progress as required by the age of knowledge-based economy, markedly boosting the production of concentrated ore and capacity to remove earth and giving face-lift to the complex, a treasure of the country.
					
					 Choe Yong Rim looked round the combined control room of Ore-dressing Shop No. 2, the fifth motor station of large cone-style crushing ground No. 2 and other places to learn about the production and technological updating there. He convened a consultative meeting of officials concerned there.
					
					 The meeting referred to the important duties to be performed by the Musan Mining Complex in keeping the production going at a high rate at the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex and other iron and steel works and in accelerating the building of an economic power. It, at the same time, discussed measures for raising the quality of concentrated ore.
					
					 It also took measures for relevant units to provide on priority basis equipment, materials and products needed for the construction of the crushing ground and repair of deep-boring machines.
					
					 Concluding the meeting, the premier called on the officials of the complex to take deep care of miners' living.
					
					 Earlier he learned about agriculture in South Hwanghae Province on the spot.

articles.title: 14th Kimilsungia Festival, Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition to Be Held
articles.content:
14th Kimilsungia Festival, Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition to Be Held
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The 14th Kimilsungia festival and Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia exhibition will take place with splendor in Pyongyang to mark the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, the Day of the Sun, and the 80th anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					 The festival and exhibition will be opened at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition House in mid-April.
					
					 They will bring together armed forces organs, ministries, national institutions, service personnel, people from all walks of life, overseas compatriots' organizations including the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and foreigners.
					
					 People in local areas will visit immortal flower shows and the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia hothouses on the above-said occasions.

articles.title: Unhasu Orchestra of DPRK Leaves Paris
articles.content:
Unhasu Orchestra of DPRK Leaves Paris 
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The Unhasu Orchestra of the DPRK led by Kwon Hyok Bong, advisor to the Korean Traditional Music Institute, Friday left Paris by air after jointly performing with the Radio Philharmonic Orchestra of France.

articles.title: Party Given for DPRK Unhasu Orchestra's Successful Performance
articles.content:
Party Given for DPRK Unhasu Orchestra's Successful Performance 
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- A party was given by French Minister of Culture of France Frederic Mitterand on March 15 to congratulate the Unhasu Orchestra of the DPRK upon its successful performance.
					 Present at the party on invitation were the Unhasu Orchestra headed by Kwon Hyok Bong, advisor to the Korean Traditional Music Institute, the chief and staff members of the DPRK mission in France, Jong Myong Hun, music director of the Radio Philharmonic Orchestra of France, and those concerned of the joint performance.
					
					 Present there were those concerned of the French Ministry of Culture and the Radio Broadcasting of France including the minister of Culture and the general director of the Radio Broadcasting of France.
					
					 The French minister of Culture in his address extended thanks to the DPRK government for having sent the Unhasu Orchestra composed of talented and promising players.
					
					 The minister hoped that the joint performance will mark an occasion in boosting the cultural exchange between the two countries.
					
					 The joint performance helped have a better understanding of the Korean musical art of world standard, the minister said.
					
					 Kwon Hyok Bong in his reply expressed thanks to the French government for its efforts for successful joint performance.
					
					 He referred to the long-standing cultural exchange between the DPRK and France.
					
					 The performance laid a firm foundation for boosting the cultural exchange between the two countries, he said.

articles.title: DPRK Men Soccer Team Advances into Final Match of 2012 AFC Challenger Cup
articles.content:
DPRK Men Soccer Team Advances into Final Match of 2012 AFC Challenger Cup
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- A semi-final match of the 2012 AFC Challenger Cup between the DPRK and Palestinian teams took place on March 16.
					 The DPRK team beat its Palestinian rival 2:0.
					
					 It will have the final match with its Turkmen rival on March 19.

articles.title: FIFA Premier Coaching Course Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
FIFA Premier Coaching Course Held in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- A FIFA premier coaching course was held at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang from Saturday to Thursday.
					 Coaches from various sports teams of the country took part in the course, divided into theoretical and practical sections.
					
					 The course focused on such issues as footballers' physical and mental conditions before match and team's attack and defense tactics and goal-in.
					
					 It was officiated by Detlev Bruggemann, a technical instructor of FIFA.

articles.title: KCNA Detailed Report on Successes Made in Construction of Tanchon Port
articles.content:
KCNA Detailed Report on Successes Made in Construction of Tanchon Port
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency Thursday released a detailed report on the achievements made by the builders of Tanchon Port in South Hamgyong Province on the east coast of Korea as regards the port construction nearing completion. 
					 The construction of the port covering hundreds of thousands of square meters is a difficult nature-remaking project to build a modern port capable of handling millions of metric tons of cargo even under unfavorable natural and geographical conditions of the east coast.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il unrolled a blueprint for successfully building Tanchon Port of weighty significance in developing the country's marine transport, foreign trade and economy and improving the people's living standard as required by the new century. He, at the same time, energetically led the effort for carrying it out.
					
					 The report said:
					
					 Thanks to the heroic effort of the builders, the projects for building two breakwaters extending nearly 2 000 meters were completed in a matter of less than two years, though they would have taken more than a decade at an ordinary pace and overall construction projects including the wharf and main building of the port have been carried out 95 percent.
					
					 The port construction which started on July 29, 2009 reminded one of a big battle from its outset.
					
					 A marine route was explored in a brief span of time for transporting construction materials and large-scale blasting conducted more than ten times to secure stones and earth in large quantities.
					
					  The projects of the northern and southern breakwaters which account for 60 percent of the port construction made a big progress. As a result, the structures of breakwaters, each extending hundreds of meters, made their appearances in a matter of a little over three months.
					
					 The introduction of more than one hundred new methods of port construction including the application of framed groundwork structures made it possible to raise the speed of building breakwaters more than five times, ten times at maximum, as compared with that in the past and wind them up as of August last year ahead of schedule.
					
					 Overall construction projects including breakwaters, wharfs and the building of facilities made headway in a three dimensional manner.
					
					 The projects for the construction of wharfs Nos. 1, 2, 3 and 4 extending much more than a thousand meters and the work for paving the ground for cargo covering tens of thousands of square meters were finished in a short span of time.
					
					 Rails were laid for port cranes and an observation deck, a bridge and a huge cargo storehouse constructed.
					
					 The appearance of the port has changed beyond recognition with the construction of two breakwaters stretching far into deep waters of the East Sea, vast wharfs, modern buildings and its afforested compound reminiscent of a big park.
					
					 The builders are now putting increased spurs to completing the port construction at a high level.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun All Service Members Are Waiting for Order to Fire
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun All Service Members Are Waiting for Order to Fire
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- All servicepersons of the Korean People's Army, fully ready to launch a sacred war of retaliation with a will to wipe out the enemies, are just waiting for an order to shower fire on them.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The sacred war of Korean style is a manifestation of the resolution force with arms the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors to pay a thousand-fold dearer price for the thrice-cursed crimes against ethics and morality and glorify the history of the great sun for all ages. It is also aimed to hold in high esteem Kim Jong Un, another peerlessly great man who is identical to general secretary Kim Jong Il, and implement the leader's last instructions for national reunification at any cost.
					
					 The above-said war to eliminate such traitors as Lee Myung Bak, Kim Kwan Jin and Jong Sung Jo with arms of Mt. Paektu is the storm for self-destruction they have invited themselves.
					
					 It will result in making a clean sweep of the worst traitors who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK in a bid to prolong their dirty remaining days and getting the pent-up grudge of the nation settled without fail.
					
					 Those conservative media and all hues of riff-raffs in south Korea who had been involved in the Lee group's racket for confrontation with the DPRK even a bit will never escape the strike of the DPRK style.
					
					 The world will clearly witness the inexhaustible and tremendous might of Kim Il Sung's nation, Kim Jong Il's Korea where all service personnel and people have risen up in the spirit of Mt. Paektu to protect the dignity of its supreme leadership.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Exposes What Lee Group Seeks through "Nuclear Security Summit"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Exposes What Lee Group Seeks through "Nuclear Security Summit" 
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The ulterior aim sought by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors through the "Nuclear Security Summit" is to turn it into a platform for doing harm to the DPRK and escalate the anti-DPRK nuclear drumbeats worldwide in collusion with the U.S.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday observes this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 It was for this purpose that the south Korean puppet group was busy with diplomacy to host the "Nuclear Security Summit" in Seoul, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is quite illogical to discuss the issue of nuclear security in south Korea ill-famed for being a nuclear advance base of the U.S. and the biggest powder magazine in the world.
					
					 It is paradoxical for those who stage ceaseless drills for a nuclear war against the DPRK, posing a grave threat to peace and security on the Korean Peninsula, to hold an international confab under the signboard of "nuclear security."
					
					 If substantial nuclear security and peace are to be ensured on the peninsula, it is necessary to put a definite end to the nuclear war threat of the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers.
					
					 In case the "Nuclear Security Summit" is opened in south Korea, it should discuss, among other things, the moves of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities to ignite a nuclear war, the root cause of the nuclear issue on the peninsula.
					
					 Nevertheless, the Lee group of traitors, putting its crimes on the shelf, is now working hard to turn this summit into an undesirable platform for brazen-facedly hurling mud at the DPRK and doing harm to compatriots with the help of its master.
					
					 The Lee group would be well advised to give up its foolish ambition to put pressure on the DPRK and get rid of its abyss of ruin through the above-said summit.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (2)
articles.content:
"Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (2)
　　　Kim Il Sung in His Teens
					
					 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Standing at the foot of Moran Hill in Pyongyang is the Arch of Triumph, symbolic of President Kim Il Sung's feats in liberating Korea from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule.
					
					 The arch is engraved with gold letters "1925". 
					
					 In Juche 14 (1925) Kim Il Sung embarked on the road of revolution at the age of 14.
					
					 In January that year, upon hearing the news that his father Kim Hyong Jik was arrested again by the Japanese police for his revolutionary activities in northeast China, Kim Il Sung made a 250-mile journey, determined not to return home unless he achieves the country's independence. 
					
					 During his study days in Huadian and Jilin of China, he read classics on Maxism-Leninism, including "Communist Manifesto", "The Capital" and "State and Revolution", and a number of revolutionary books to make a clear-cut analysis of Korea's situation.
					
					 On October 17, 1926, he formed "Down-with-Imperialism Union" (DIU) in Hwasong Uisuk School, the first genuine revolutionary organization in Korea, marking a fresh start in the Korean revolution.
					
					 DIU was followed by the formation of the Saenal Children's Union, Young Communist League of Korea, Peasants Union, Anti-Japanese Trade Union and Anti-Japanese Women's Association.
					
					 In 1928, he personally guided the Jilin Yuwen Middle School students' walkout from classes, protest against the Jilin-Hoeryong railroad construction and the campaign boycotting Japanese goods.
					
					 He convened a historic meeting in Kalun over June 30-July 2, 1930, at which he delivered a report "The Path of the Korean Revolution".
					
					The report, tantamount to a declaration of the Juche idea, served as guidelines for strategies and tactics of the Korean revolution.
					
					 The report clarified that the popular masses are responsible for revolution which can emerge victorious only when they are set in force and that the Korean revolution should be carried on by the Korean people themselves in accordance with the country's actual situation.
					
					 The Juche-based line and policies, set forth in the report, provided a basis for building the first party organization -- the Society for Rallying Comrades -- and the Korean Revolutionary Army.  
					
					 From that time, people began calling him "Kim Il Sung", instead of his original name Kim Song Ju, wishing he would be the sun, a leader in liberating Korea from the Japanese colonial rule. 
					
					 The renaming represented the people's absolute trust in and profound reverence for him.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korea Stage Madcap War Exercises
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korea Stage Madcap War Exercises 
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korean warmongers kicked off a madcap shelling drill in Phochon, Kyonggi Province on Thursday.
					 An artillery battalion under Utah State defense forces, together with south Korean troops, took part in the drill in place of the U.S. forces in south Korea.
					
					 The shelling drill was pursuant to the "OPLAN 5027" the keynote of which is to mount a preemptive attack on the DPRK after hurling huge forces into the Korean Peninsula from the U.S. mainland. 
					
					 This was evidenced by the fact that an officer of the south Korea-U.S. Combined Forces Command asserted the shelling drill was aimed to examine the operation plan focusing on sending U.S. forces in mainland to the Korean Peninsula in case of emergency.
					
					 On the same day, the warmongers conducted joint aerial military drill in the sky over the West Sea of Korea.
					
					 The commander of the U.S. 7th Air Force and Chairman of the south Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff Jong Sung Jo separately boarded fighters, stirring up war atmosphere.
					
					 Jong, a traitor to the nation, let loose a vituperation about provocation from someone and striking the origin of provocation and supporting forces.
					
					 Their racket for a war against the DPRK has reached more reckless phase.

articles.title: S. Koreans Denounce War Drills against DPRK
articles.content:
S. Koreans Denounce War Drills against DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Veterans of pro-reunification organizations of south Korea formed a sit-down group and launched joint actions with people from all walks of life in Seoul in protest against the DPRK-targeted war drills which were kicked off by the U.S. and south Korea.
					 The group held a joint press conference with the Women's Solidarity of south Korea on March 6.
					
					  At the press conference, the speakers bitterly denounced the U.S. for staging large-scale war drills for aggression, while giving lip-service to dialogue with the north and peace. 
					
					 A series of military drills being scheduled in south Korea in March are aimed to create a favorable phase for the present conservative regime of south Korea with the general elections at hand, they said.
					
					 They urged the U.S. to stop the war drills escalating the military tension and opt to hold dialogue with sincerity.
					
					 On March 7, they launched a protest against the "government" authorities' push for building a Jeju naval base.
					
					 Next day members of different civic and public organizations, students and laid-off workers joined the sit-down group.
					
					 They held demonstration and made street speeches accusing Lee Myung Bak of posing threats to peace and the people's life with the war drills by toeing the U.S. line.
					
					 It is the only way for ensuring peace and keeping the people alive to unseat Lee Myung Bak, they noted.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Apologize to World People
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Apologize to World People
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- 17 personages of various circles of Pakistan made public a joint statement on March 8 denouncing the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK while staging the joint military exercises with the U.S. They included the chairman of the Central Committee of the Peasants and Working People's Party of Pakistan, the information secretary of the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan People's Party, the chairman of the Pakistan Association for Self－Reliance Studies, the chairman of the Karachi Juche Study Center of Pakistan and the secretary general of the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan－Korea Friendship Association.
					 They in the statement expressed deep concern over the fact that the south Korean authorities are driving the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the worst phase in league with the U.S.
					
					 The U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises are threatening the peace in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world, they said, and went on:
					
					 We cannot repress resentment at the Lee Myung Bak regime which hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 The encroachment upon the Korean people amounts to an encroachment on us.
					
					 We should make redoubled efforts to grow stronger, create things and not yield to the provocateurs.
					
					This is a serious lesson drawn by us close friends of the Korean people who trust the great persons of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The despicable imperialists are still running the whole gamut of plots to bring down the socialist fortress.
					
					 But the great heritages of President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il, the great sages, are shining and the machinations of the enemies are bound to go bust thanks to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 We are proud of the Korean people who love peace and have bolstered the capability for self-defence, holding the great persons of Mt. Paektu in high esteem.
					
					 We demand the south Korean authorities stop their moves against the DPRK and apologize to the world people for their crimes.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Accused of Violence against Naval Base Construction Protesters
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Accused of Violence against Naval Base Construction Protesters 
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations including the All-Islanders Measure Committee for Checking Jeju Military Base Construction and the Joint Conference of Human Rights Organizations on March 10 held a press conference in Sogwipho, Jeju Island, condemning unreasonable suppression by police.
					 They censured the police for walking away over 50 protesters, when counted only from March 7, including members of the organizations and foreign peace activists, pressing for the base construction. 
					
					 In particular, they exposed outrages by cops who kicked and strangled protesters. 
					
					 The arrest and violence are evident human rights abuses, they charged.

articles.title: Strong Earthquakes Hit Japan in Succession
articles.content:
Strong Earthquakes Hit Japan in Succession 
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Strong earthquakes hit Japan in succession recently, throwing its population into serious unrest and horror.
					  6.8 magnitude quake jolted Tohoku region on Mar. 14.
					
					 Its epicenter was about 10 km deep in waters off Sanriku.
					
					 Tsunami 20 cm high was reportedly observed in some coastal areas the moment quake occurred. 
					
					 The quake rocked the buildings in Hokkaido, Aomori and Iwate prefectures and other areas for dozens of seconds, causing many inhabitants to take emergency refuge.
					
					 The Japan Agency of Meteorology advised the inhabitants in all coastal areas of the above-said regions to swiftly come out of high-rise buildings and dwelling houses and evacuate to high places due to possible unabated aftershock.
					
					 Some hours later a quake measuring 6.1 on the Richter scale occurred in the waters east of Chiba Prefecture.
					
					 The quake left fences in Chiba and Ibaraki prefectures destroyed and window panes of buildings broken. 
					
					 A powerful shock was observed in the heart of Tokyo, too.
					
					 According to the above-said agency, these quakes are aftershocks of the mega quakes last year and aftershocks measuring more than 5 on the Richter scale are likely to continue in a week to come.

articles.title: Iranian President Accuses West of Supporting Israel
articles.content:
Iranian President Accuses West of Supporting Israel
						
 Tehran, March 15 (KCNA) -- Western supporters of Israel are losing credibility in the eyes of the international community, the Iranian president said.
					 Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad described the Israeli government as a "dead" regime. 
					
					 "You have made investments and are losing face for the sake of a bunch of criminals and are not aware that the Zionist regime is like a rotten tree that you have invested in, but you will lose face," he was quoted by the semiofficial Mehr News Agency as saying.

articles.title: AL Condemns Continuous Israeli Raids on Gaza
articles.content:
AL Condemns Continuous Israeli Raids on Gaza
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Arab League (AL) chief Nabil al- Arabi on Monday condemned Israel's continuous raids on the Gaza Strip which have left more than 20 dead since Friday.
					 In a statement, Arabi called on the UN Security Council to bear its responsibilities and take a decisive stance to stop such brutal actions in accordance with the international human rights law and the Geneva agreement signed in 1949.

articles.title: Belarus Terms West's Economic Sanctions Unproductive
articles.content:
Belarus Terms West's Economic Sanctions Unproductive
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- A senior Belarusian official said on Tuesday that the country believes the EU economic sanctions against it are not only unacceptable, but also unproductive. 
					 Belarus expresses its regret over the EU economic restrictions, as they will inevitably affect the interests of both Belarusian and European businessmen, the country's Deputy Foreign Minister Alexander Guryanov told local media on Tuesday.
					
					 Regarding sanctions as a vulnerable measure, the deputy foreign minister said Belarus hopes that the EU will take into consideration the interests of businesses.

articles.title: Bolivian President Condemns U.S. Moves against Cuba
articles.content:
Bolivian President Condemns U.S. Moves against Cuba
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Bolivian President Evo Morales on March 12 condemned the U.S. for its dastardly move to bar Cuba from participating in the summit of the Organization of American States due to be held in April.
					 He branded such behavior of the U.S. as undemocratic and discriminating act.
					
					 The U.S. is ignoring the wishes of the regional countries, he said, declaring that the member states of ALBA and MERCOSUR are supporting Cuba's participation in the summit.
					
					 Such move of the U.S. is only reinforcing the anti-imperialist stand of the governments and people of Latin American countries, he added.

articles.title: Iranian Majlis Condemns U.S. Soldier's Killing of Civilians
articles.content:
Iranian Majlis Condemns U.S. Soldier's Killing of Civilians
 Tehran, March 15 (KCNA) -- The National Security and Foreign Policy Committee of the Iranian Majlis in a statement on March 12 strongly condemned the U.S. forces in Afghanistan for killing civilians. 
					 The statement said that a U.S. soldier recently killed 16 innocent Afghans including women and children. This fully shows the vulnerability of the U.S. forces, it added.
					
					 Such atrocities will go on as long as there remain U.S. forces in Afghanistan, it said, stressing that the pullout of the U.S. forces from Afghanistan is the only way of preventing the recurrence of such atrocity.

articles.title: Former U.S. Attorney-General Deplores Drumbeats of War in U.S., Israel
articles.content:
Former U.S. Attorney-General Deplores Drumbeats of War in U.S., Israel 
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Former U.S. Attorney General Ramsey Clark on Tuesday deplored the drumbeats of war that are being heard in the U.S. and Israel against Iran, calling for easing tension to thwart the looming war. 
					 Speaking on the sidelines of the 19th meeting of the United Nations Human Rights Council, he said: 'When you speak with language of force and threaten a nation with war, you are violating that nation's fundamental right to peaceful life." 
					
					 He said that no country has the right to commit crime.

articles.title: 15 Killed in U.S. Drone Strikes in Pakistan
articles.content:
15 Killed in U.S. Drone Strikes in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces present in Afghanistan keep making air raids on Pakistan under the signboard of "war on terrorism."
					 At least 15 Pakistanis were killed and several others wounded in U.S. drone strikes launched on Tuesday in North Waziristan and South Waziristan of Pakistan.

articles.title: World Water Crisis and Efforts to Settle It
articles.content:
World Water Crisis and Efforts to Settle It
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- March 22 is World Water Day.
					 The 47th Session of the UN General Assembly held in January 1993 decided to mark March 22 every year as World Water Day to strengthen the comprehensive and coordinated planning and management and protection of water resources.
					
					 For the past several decades the amount of water used increased 4-8 percent every year. Water will be reportedly more expensive than oil worldwide in the future as agricultural water accounts for 70 percent and industrial water 20 percent in the amount of fresh water used.
					
					 At present 40 percent of the global population is facing shortage of water.
					
					 The water crisis is foreseen to be more serious in the future. 3 500 million people will suffer water shortage in 2025.
					
					 The United Nations Children's Fund announced that over 1.6 million children under 5 die worldwide every year due to the use of polluted water.
					
					 Under such situation many countries in the world are greatly concerned for the work to protect water resources and solve the water problem.
					
					 The Algerian president said that his government set a solution to the problem as top priority and is channeling a large amount of money into the construction of 18 new dams, the refining of seawater, waste water disposal, the prospecting of underground water and other projects.
					
					 The Mexican president noted that the government set forth a solution to the water problem as a primary task for the security of the state and the Guinean president said his government would make efforts to satisfactorily provide drinking water to all areas including the capital city.
					
					 The Kenyan president made it clear that the government would make sustained great efforts to increase the production of electricity and put water supply on a normal footing.
					
					 New plans were worked out in different countries including China, Angola and Mozambique on the basis of the achievements made in solving the water problem in the past.
					
					 Various countries will make sustained efforts to settle the acute shortage of water in the future, too.

articles.title: Russian Strategic Rocket Forces Start Combat Patrol
articles.content:
Russian Strategic Rocket Forces Start Combat Patrol 
 Moscow, March 15 (KCNA) -- Russia is currently channeling great efforts into boosting the combating capabilities of its strategic rocket forces.
					 Topol, Topol-M and Yars, mobile missile complexes, began their rounds of patrol in central Russia, Ural and Siberia.  At present, most of the battalions and regiments of the missile complexes are training the ways for the performance of their mission.
					
					 The spokesman for the rocket forces of Russia said this on Mar. 14.

articles.title: U.S. Reinforces Armed Forces in Mideast
articles.content:
U.S. Reinforces Armed Forces in Mideast
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The United States is busy reinforcing its troops in the Mideast, escalating tensions in the region.
					 The aircraft carrier Enterprise set sail on March 11 for military operation in the region.
					
					 The carrier is said to anchor there for 7 months to come.

articles.title: Fairness of Media Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Fairness of Media Demanded in S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The Yonhap News branch of the south Korean media trade union has launched an indefinite strike on March 15 amid high-pitched actions of the trade unions of media opposing the south Korean "government" authorities' moves to dominate it.
					 The trade union held a rally before strike. 
					
					 Since Pak Jong Chan took the post of chairman of the Yonhap News three years ago, it has released prejudiced and partial reports in favor of the "government", it deplored.
					
					 Pak should not be allowed to stay in office, it said, calling for turning out in an all-out action for his ouster and impartial media.

articles.title: Nationality of Lee Myung Bak Is Doubtful: Federation of Koreans in U.S.
articles.content:
Nationality of Lee Myung Bak Is Doubtful: Federation of Koreans in U.S.
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. on Sunday made public a commentary condemning Lee Myung Bak's treachery.
					 The commentary said that Lee Myung Bak of south Korea contributed an article to the Japanese newspaper Asahi Shimbun one year after the devastating earthquake and tsunami in Japan.
					
					 In the article Lee talked about "reaffirmation of genuine friendship and bonds" with Japan. He said he would render unreserved support to Japan in the future, too, noting that difficulties test a real friend, the commentary exposed.
					
					 But he did not even mention Koreans in tsunami-ravaged areas in Japan, it said, adding:
					
					 A large amount of relief fund sent by the north was evenly handed out to all disaster-stricken Koreans regardless of whether they belonged to Chongryon or Mindan, encouraging them to rise from despair.
					
					 This made the Koreans in Japan skeptical about his nationality as he did not render help to Koreans even though he gave help to Japan. This left Mindan-lined Koreans in Japan vulnerable from both Japan and the south Korean authorities.
					
					 Despite frantic aid from south Korea, Japan has kept insisting that "Tok Islets belong to Japan" and specified it in the Japanese history textbooks. It still goes without apology and reparation for his past crimes against Koreans.
					
					 The commentary cast doubt about Lee's nationality as he calls for "deep friendship and bonds" even though he was betrayed by Japan being hit on the back part of his head by it.
					
					 It derided "deep friendship and bonds" as pro-Japanese Lee Myung Bak's friendship and bonds with Japan.

articles.title: Korea, Inventor of Drilling & Blasting Operation
articles.content:
Korea, Inventor of Drilling & Blasting Operation
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- One of the world's invention books shows that the drilling and blasting method for mining was invented by an Austrian engineer in 1627.
					 However, Korea acquired this technique earlier than Austria, according to "Chronicles of King Sonjo", a book released during the Ri Dynasty (1392-1910).
					
					 The book says that in September 1606 a man, called Kim Kyong Rim, suggested to the then King Sonjo a drilling and blasting method with a purpose to exploit silver mine in Kyonggi Province of Korea.
					
					 The fact goes to prove that this method had been used in Korea before 1606.
					
					 In Korea, black powder was invented for military use during the Koryo Kingdom (918-1392).
					
					 The Korean nation has contributed to the development of human civilization by making lots of excellent inventions from olden times.

articles.title: Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception 
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery Sukhinin hosted a reception at his embassy Friday to mark the 63rd anniversary of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and the Russian Federation. 
					 Present there on invitation were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned. 
					
					 Staff members of the Russian embassy here took part in the reception. 
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Work Off Press in Mexico
articles.content:
Work Off Press in Mexico
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism published in booklet President Kim Il Sung's work "On the Five-Point Policy for National Reunification" on March 10.
					 The work, published on June 25, Juche 62 (1973), clarifies the contents, significance and validity of the said policy.
					
					 The policy calls for defusing the military confrontation and tensions between the north and the south and realizing many-sided cooperation and interchange between them.
					
					 It also calls for convening the Great National Congress composed of representatives of the people from all walks of life and representatives of political parties and social organizations in the north and the south.
					
					 It envisages the establishment of a north-south federation under a single national nomenclature.
					
					 The policy calls on the north and south to work together in the field of external activities and enter the UN under the name of the Federal Republic of Koryo.

articles.title: Seminar for Commemorating Centenary of Birth Held in South Africa
articles.content:
Seminar for Commemorating Centenary of Birth Held in South Africa
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- A seminar for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung was held in South Africa on March 10.
					 Eddie Kekana, chairman of the Group for the Study of the Progressive Ideas of South Africa, in a report said Kim Il Sung founded the Juche idea in the early days of his revolutionary struggle and, on the basis of it, laid down the Juche-oriented line of the Korean revolution, adding:
					
					 He put up a slogan for going amongst people and devoted himself to them all his life.
					
					 As he reposed undisputed trust in the might of the popular masses, Kim Il Sung victoriously led the anti-Japanese armed struggle with neither state backing nor support from a regular army, finally liberating Korea, and won a victory in the three-year-long Korean War.
					
					 He dedicated himself to the people, always making journeys to mix with people.
					
					 That is why the Korean people always remember and revere him no matter how much water may flow under the bridge.
					
					 The speakers explained and proved the originality and tremendous vitality of the Songun policy pursued by general secretary Kim Jong Il, noting that it is just the only treasured sword for defending socialism in the DPRK and hastening the successful building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: RPDC lanzara satelite artificial de usos practicos, declara el CTEC
articles.content:
RPDC lanzara satelite artificial de usos practicos, declara el CTEC
 Pyongyang, 16 de marzo (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Comite de Tecnologias Espaciales de Corea (CTEC) publico este viernes la siguiente declaracion:
					 Con motivo del centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung (15 de abril), la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea lanzara un satelite artificial de usos practicos fabricado con las fuerzas y tecnologias domesticas.
					
					  En virtud de la politica del gobierno de la RPDC en materia de desarrollo y uso pacifico del cosmos, nuestros cientificos y tecnicos vinieron trabajando intensamente en la investigacion para desarrollar los satelites de usos practicos imprescindibles al desarrollo de economia nacional en base al lanzamiento exitoso de 2 satelites artificiales piloto.
					
					  En ese curso, se logro un desarrollo vertiginoso en la rama de ciencias y tecnicas espaciales del pais y se sento la firme base material y tecnica para lanzar y operar normalmente los satelites de usos practicos.
					
					  El "Kwangmyongsong-3", a ser lanzado esta vez, se trata de un satelite de observacion de la Tierra que girara siguiendo la orbita polar.
					
					  Sera lanzado a bordo del cohete transportador "Unha-3" entre los dias 12 y 16 de abril hacia el sur desde el Campo de Lanzamiento de Satelites Sohae en el distrito de Cholsan de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte.
					
					  Su orbita de navegacion ha sido determinada con seguridad, de manera que los restos del cohete transportador, que sean generados en el proceso de lanzamiento, no afecten a los Estados circunvecinos.
					
					  En el lanzamiento de ese satelite cientifico-tecnico con fines pacificos, la RPDC observara totalmente las normas y costumbres internacionales correspondientes y asegurara al maximo la transparencia para contribuir al fomento de confianza internacional y cooperacion en la investigacion de ciencias espaciales y el lanzamiento de satelites.
					
					  El lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3" estimulara mucho a nuestros militares y civiles, que aceleran la construccion de un Estado prospero, y marcara un hito importante para elevar a la nueva altura las tecnologias nacionales para el uso del cosmos con fines pacificos.

articles.title: Cientificos coreanos se entrevistan con la ACNC
articles.content:
Cientificos coreanos se entrevistan con la ACNC
 Pyongyang, 16 de marzo (ACNC) -- La Corea del Songun, que acogera pronto el centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung, informo al mundo que sera lanzado a bordo del cohete transportador "Unha-3" entre los dias 12 y 16 de abril el "Kwangmyongsong-3", satelite de observacion de la Tierra que girara siguiendo la orbita polar.
					 El investigador de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias Ri Sun Chol (39 anos de edad) expresa a la ACNC:
					
					 El orgullo de los funcionarios e investigadores de nuestra academia llego al cielo como lo hara pronto el "Kwangmyongsong-3".
					
					 Estoy tan emocionado como aquellos dias en que fueron lanzados los satelites piloto "Kwangmyongsong" no.1 y 2.
					
					 Se ve que nuestra ciencia y tecnologia llegaron a la cima abriendo la nueva epoca de desarrollo independiente.
					
					 El lanzamiento venidero sera un gran acontecimiento que mostrara a todo el mundo que la RPDC es potencia no solo en el plano politico y militar sino tambien en la rama cientifico-tecnica.
					
					 El subdirector del Instituto Central de Analisis de Experimentos, Choe Ung Chol (45 anos de edad) asevero:
					
					 Cuando supe esa noticia conmovedora, me vino a la mente la imagen generosa del Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien convirtio el pais en una potencia cientifico-tecnica iluminando la senda de desarrollo de la rama.
					
					 El lanzamiento del satelite de observacion de la Tierra ensenara claramente a todo el mundo que la construccion del Estado prospero en Corea no es una palabra huera.
					
					 El director del Instituto de Informacion del Medio Ambiente Global, Jo Il Kwang (51 anos de edad) subrayo:
					
					 Segun la politica de desarrollo y uso pacifico del espacio del gobierno de la RPDC, nuestros cientificos y tecnicos realizaron ya con exito el lanzamiento de dos satelites piloto.
					
					 Como reconoce todo el mundo, el cohete transportador o el satelite artificial son el combinado de ciencias y tecnologias de punta y pueden ser fabricados solo en algunos paises avanzados.
					
					 El "Kwangmyongsong-3", a ser lanzado esta vez, se trata de un satelite cientifico que brindara generalmente las informaciones necesarias a la investigacion del espacio y a la observacion de la Tierra.
					
					 En el futuro tambien, nuestros cientificos mantendran la dignidad y el honor del pais como fabricador y lanzador de satelite artificial.

articles.title: Lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3" demostrarapoderio de la RPDC
articles.content:
Lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3" demostrarapoderio de la RPDC
 Pyongyang, 16 de marzo (ACNC) -- Segun la declaracion publicada al mediodia de hoy por el portavoz del Comite de Tecnologias Espaciales de Corea (CTEC), la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea lanzara a mediados de abril que viene el satelite de observacion de la Tierra "Kwangmyongsong-3".
					 Esa noticia hace vibrar de alegria y emocion a los militares y civiles de la RPDC.
					
					 Citado por la ACNC, el oficial del Ejercito Popular de Corea, So Yong Il (52 anos de edad), dijo que se siente tan emocionado como si estuviera girando alrededor de la Tierra a bordo del satelite artificial.
					
					 Anadio que el lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3" sera una herencia del patriotismo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, quien dedico todo lo suyo para acoger el centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung como gran fiesta a ser registrada en letras mayusculas en la historia nacional.
					
					 La investigadora del Instituto Central de Mineria de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, Ri Kil Sun (47 anos de edad) senalo:
					
					 Cuando tuve noticia del lanzamiento del satelite de observacion de la Tierra que girara en la orbita polar, me vinieron a la mente los episodios de gran abnegacion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Gracias a la sabia guia del Dirigente que convirtio nuestro pais en el Estado con armas nucleares y en el fabricador y lanzador de satelite artificial de talla mundial, nuestras ciencias y tecnicas espaciales llegaron a un nivel mas alto.
					
					 El jefe del equipo de trabajo de la Fabrica de Ventanas de Aluminio Aeguk de Mangyongdae, Choe Man Sun (31 anos de edad) destaco:
					
					 Esto es un acontecimiento historico que mostrara el poderio de la autoctona industria nacional preparada a cambio de sangre y sudor de nuestro pueblo bajo la guia del gran lider y el gran partido, y el nivel cientifico-tecnico del pais.
					
					 Nuestro pais emergio como digna potencia cientifico-tecnica y se convertira sin falta en un Estado prospero donde vivira feliz toda la poblacion.
					
					 Pronto el mundo sera testigo nuevamente de la dignidad de la Corea del Songun y su indestructible poderio nacional.

articles.title: Inaugurada exposicion conjunta de fotos ACNC-AP en EE.UU.
articles.content:
Inaugurada exposicion conjunta de fotos ACNC-AP en EE.UU. 
 Nueva York, 16 de marzo (ACNC) -- Con motivo del centenario del natalicio (15 de abril) del Presidente Kim Il Sung, quedo inaugurada en el neoyorquino Museo de Bellas Artes Rubin la exhibicion conjunta de fotografias bajo coauspicios de la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea (KCNA) y la agencia noticiera estadounidense AP. 
					 En esta galeria de fotos bajo el titulo de "Cuadro verdadero de Corea" fueron exhibidas las ejemplares referentes a las imborrables proezas revolucionarias del Presidente Kim Il Sung, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un realizadas por la construccion de una patria prospera, la felicidad del pueblo, la reunificacion independiente y pacifica de Corea y la verificacion de la causa de independencia en el mundo entero, y las otras que muestran las actividades revolucionarias de esos Generales del monte Paektu. 
					
					 Tambien se ven las fotos que reflejan el poderio de la unidad monolitica entre el Dirigente y el pueblo, los aspectos de desarrollo de Corea alcanzado en varios dominios como la politica, la economia y la cultura bajo la guia del partido y el lider, y una parte de la vida feliz de los habitantes coreanos. 
					
					 En la exposicion participaron la delegacion de la ACNC encabezada por el primer subdirector general Kim Chang Gwang, los miembros de la AP incluso el vicepresidente en jefe Kathleen Carroll y el vicepresidente John Daniszewski, las personalidades de distintos estratos de EE.UU., los funcionarios del Museo de Bellas Artes Rubin, los ciudadanos neoyorquinos y los miembros de la representacion coreana ante la ONU. 
					
					  En la ocasion hubo discursos de apertura. 
					
					  Pronuncio primero la palabra de felicitacion el presidente de la Fundacion Rubin, Donald Rubin,  quien aplaudio la apertura exitosa de la exposicion conjunta de fotos ACNC-AP.
					
					  Deseo que el presente acto sea el primer paso de reconciliacion cultural y politica y que se logre la reconciliacion entre los gobiernos de EE.UU. y la RPDC.
					
					  Kathleen Carroll dijo que es la maxima fiesta de la nacion coreana el 15 de abril, centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung, fundador de la RPDC, y le complace inaugurar la galeria de fotos en visperas de esa efemeride.
					
					  Subrayo que tambien en el futuro la AP informara ampliamente al mundo las novedades de la RPDC.
					
					  Kim Chang Gwang felicito calidamente la apertura de la galeria que tiene lugar en Nueva York bajo coauspicios de la ACNC y la AP con motivo del significativo Dia del Sol. 
					
					  Deseo que la galeria contribuya a fomentar el entendimiento mutuo de los pueblos de los dos paises y mejorar las relaciones bilaterales al presentar los acontecimientos principales en Corea, las noticias de la construccion del Estado prospero, la cultura y la historia de ella. 
					
					  Luego, los participantes pasaron revista a las fotos exhibidas. 
					
					  En la ocasion, ellos compararon las fotos de diferentes estilos expuestas por dos agencias noticieras y adquirieron visualmente un nuevo entendimiento de Corea. 
					
					  Por la noche de ese dia, se ofrecio un banquete con motivo de la inauguracion.
					
					  La galeria continuara hasta el 13 de abril, de acuerdo con el memorando de entendimiento ACNC-AP firmado en junio del ano pasado.

articles.title: Frederic Mitterand ofrece banquete en honor de Orquesta Unhasu
articles.content:
Frederic Mitterand ofrece banquete en honor de Orquesta Unhasu
 Pyongyang, 16 de marzo (ACNC) -- El ministro frances de Cultura, Frederic Mitterand, ofrecio el dia 15 un banquete en honor de la Orquesta Unhasu felicitando el exito de su funcion.
					 A la ocasion fueron invitados Kwon Hyok Bong, asesor del Instituto de Musicas Tradicionales de Corea quien preside dicha Orquesta, el jefe y otros miembros de la representacion de la RPDC acreditada en Francia, el director de musica de la Orquesta Filarmonica de Radio de Francia Jong Myong Hun e interesados de la funcion conjunta.
					
					 Tambien participaron el ministro de Cultura Frederic Mitterand, el director general y otros interesados del Ministerio de Cultura y de la Radioemisora de Francia.
					
					 El ministro senalo en su discurso que da agradecimiento al gobierno coreano que envio a Francia la Orquesta Unhasu compuesta por los talentosos y prometedores interpretadores.
					
					 Deseo que se fortalezca y se desarrolle el intercambio cultural entre ambos paises con motivo del concierto conjunto.
					
					 Destaco que el presente concierto hizo saber bien sobre el arte musical de Corea en el nivel mundial.
					
					 Kwon Hyok Bong, en su discurso, expreso el agradecimiento al gobierno frances que hizo realizar con exito el concierto conjunto.
					
					 Se refirio a que el intercambio cultural entre Corea y Francia tiene larga historia.
					
					 Destaco que a traves de dicho concierto se ha preparado la magnifica base para ampliar y desarrollar el intercambio cultural entre los dos paises.
